page.title: 15ORIELTON SCHOOL
page.content: The School was opened with 40 children on Monday 15 December 1873. The first master was Mr. John Crisp. The school was apparently given its name because of close ties with the local Orielton Estate, whose owners, the Saurin family, may have donated the land. In the years following, up to the present, 8 men have been Headteacher. Mr. Clifford Davies has held the post since 1972. Altogether 37 men and women have taught as Assistant Teachers at the school since it was opened, not including 11 Supply Teachers and 7 Part-Time Teachers. On its registers are details of 2087 pupils. Originally an all-age school, the pupils now attending are all between the ages of 4 and 11+.
